caption:
The photograph depicts a scrapyard scene focused on the recycling and dismantling of cars. In the foreground, a large magnetic crane is lifting a load of metal scraps, presumably from cars. The metal scraps dangle from a heavy-duty chain attached to the crane, which appears composed of large links and a bottom hook. The crane is captured in action, showing a dynamic, falling stream of smaller metal pieces from the main bulk of the scrap, providing a sense of motion.

Behind the crane, piles of multicolored car carcasses are visible. These cars are in various stages of dismantlement, with missing parts, exposed frames, and crumpled bodiesâ€”highlighting the primary function of this yard, which seems to be breaking down cars for parts and metal.

In the far background, you can see trees and hints of a clear sky, suggesting that the scrapyard is located in a rural or semi-rural area with significant open space around it. The overall scene communicates a busy industrial operation focusing on recycling and waste management within the automotive industry.
title: Shredded steel loaded on railway cars.  (from the documerica-1 exhibition.  For other images in this assignment, see fiche numbers 63, 64, 65.)
